Key Match Events: India captain Rohit Sharma scored 39-3 when Rishabh Pant was bowled for 18.
Suryakumar hits an unbeaten 50 to lead India to 111-3 with 10 balls to spare.
Netravalkar removes Kohli for a golden duck before dismissing Rohit.
USA post 110-8: Nitish 27 (23); Arshdeep 4-9 - Siraj takes a superb catch to dismiss Nitish.
Pre-Game Insights: India knew this was a tough task but showed maturity to take the game to the end.
USA captain Aaron Jones said they were 10-15 runs short on the pitch and felt 125-130 would have been a tough total to chase.
Daniel Norcross commented that USA went toe-to-toe with one of the best teams in the world and played with good discipline.
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win.
Aaron Jones acknowledged that despite the loss, the team put up a good fight and is still in contention for the Super 8s.
Daniel Norcross praised the USA for their performance and the crowd's support.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The official attendance today is 31,219, the second biggest crowd at this ground during the tournament.
India reached the Super 8s with an eventually comfortable win over the USA.
Shivam Dube hits two down the ground to seal the victory.
